header.title: The Calling to the First of Witch Blood

central_thesis: This invocation establishes a direct magical current with Cain, presented as the primordial 'First of Witch Blood,' the 'living Son of Satan and Lilith,' and an 'Adversarial deific force.' The core system facilitates a transformative, antinomian self-initiation, where the practitioner embodies Cain's rebellious gnosis, embraces self-reliance, and aligns with the infernal current for personal apotheosis and expanded consciousness.

structure_content.summary: The text begins with a dedication to the Luciferian Sabbat and those seeking the 'gnosis of the Adversary.' It defines the 'Circle of Cain' as an initiatory path into the adversarial deific force embodied by Cain, identifying him as the 'living Son of Satan and Lilith,' representing dark instinctual desire and willed continual existence.

The narrator recounts a personal journey of initiation, marked by symbolic 'scribing' in the 'blood of Abel,' signifying an embrace of the antinomian path. This journey involves pain, a 'blinding heat,' descent into a 'created hell,' and the discovery of 'heaven' through 'isolation and self-reliance.' This leads to an 'ecstasy of transformation' where the 'blood of my shell encircled me,' and the 'father' (dragon/daemon/Cain) is summoned, igniting the soul and opening the eyes anew.

The central section is a direct invocation to Cain, addressed with various epithets: 'o wanderer who bears a black thorn stick,' 'who the blood of Abel did ignite your senses,' 'who lifted thee up into the flames of your father,' 'awakened in the arms of Lilith, the Moon,' 'Cain of Old, whose words open the gates of hell,' 'Cain of the serpent skin, who is the first of witch blood,' 'earthly devil,' and 'master of spirits.' The invocation commands Cain to 'Encircle and awaken within my flesh, my blood, my mind,' facilitating the practitioner's rebirth.

The invocation concludes with a powerful affirmation of the practitioner's rebirth 'by thy depths' and a declaration of aligning with 'the Name and Mark of the Devil,' swearing one's spirit unto it. The practitioner asserts themselves as 'the redeemer and bringer of the Infernal Pact,' whose desires are fulfilled by the 'Eye within the blackened triangle.' It calls upon 'Cain and the Children of Rebellion' to rise within, and for Satan's name to be blessed and remain. The text culminates in the identification of the practitioner with the Adversary's various names ('Opposer', 'Fornicator', 'Deceiver') and a declaration of eternal existence through the fusion of 'Body of shadow, Body of Light' aligned in 'Noon and by Moon lit night'.

key_concepts.definition: The central deific figure, portrayed as the 'First of Witch Blood,' 'living Son of Satan and Lilith,' 'earthly devil,' and 'master of spirits.' He embodies the antinomian, adversarial, and instinctual force leading to self-initiation and rebellion. His lineage is presented as a conduit for specific magical power.

A multifaceted concept encompassing Satan, Lilith, and Cain. It represents a deific force of 'dark instinctual desire and willed continual existence,' leading to experiential knowledge (gnosis) that promotes self-reliance and personal transformation. The practitioner ultimately identifies with this force, taking on its names (Opposer, Fornicator, Deceiver).

The ceremonial or spiritual gathering/tradition dedicated to Luciferian principles, serving as the broader context for the invocation. It implies a collective or individual pursuit of self-illumination and sovereignty through adversarial currents.

A spiritual commitment or agreement with 'the Devil' (the Adversary), signifying a deep alignment with antinomian forces and a claim to power and self-redemption. The practitioner becomes the 'redeemer and bringer' of this pact, implying active manifestation of its principles.

A spiritual and possibly genetic lineage or inherent magical potency linked directly to Cain, signifying a primal connection to rebellious and powerful forces. The invocation aims to awaken this blood within the practitioner.

A symbolic representation of awakened insight, vision, and power, likely an internal spiritual faculty (e.g., third eye) or a specific magical sigil, through which the practitioner's desires are fulfilled and their gnosis intensified.

The core magical process experienced by the practitioner, moving from a state of pain and self-reliance through a 'created hell' to an 'ecstasy of transformation' and rebirth. This is achieved by internalizing Cain and the Adversary, culminating in an eternal state of 'life to never end'.

practical_system.description: The text outlines a system of direct invocation and self-identification aimed at awakening and embodying the archetypal current of Cain within the practitioner. It functions as a ritual of internal initiation and empowerment, designed to activate 'witch blood' and establish a conscious connection to the Adversarial current. The system emphasizes a journey of personal transformation, embracing 'hell' and 'isolation' as catalysts for spiritual growth and self-reliance, culminating in a declaration of the practitioner's sovereignty and eternal existence aligned with infernal forces.
tools: **Symbolic Pen & Blood of Abel**: Represents the commitment, sacrifice, and the act of magically inscribing one's will and path.
**Black Thorn Stick**: A symbolic staff or wand, representing Cain as the 'wanderer' and a tool for direction and power.
**The Eye within the Blackened Triangle**: Can be interpreted as an internal visualization of the awakened third eye or a physical sigil/amulet to focus desire and gnosis.
**The Practitioner's Body, Blood, Mind**: The primary instruments and vessels for the invocation and internal awakening, serving as the magical temple.
rituals: **Invocation of Cain**: The primary ritual involves the recitation of the provided text as a direct address and summoning of Cain. It demands Cain's presence and an internal awakening within the practitioner's 'flesh, blood, mind.'

**Preparatory Phase**: This involves a period of intense self-reflection, embracing 'pain and a blinding heat,' confronting one's 'created hell,' and cultivating 'isolation and self-reliance.' The symbolic 'scribing in the blood of Abel' suggests a commitment to the antinomian path and a willingness to undergo transformative sacrifice.

**Self-Identification & Affirmation**: Following the invocation, the practitioner is guided to declare their own rebirth and identify directly with the invoked forces. This includes proclaiming oneself as the 'redeemer and bringer of the Infernal Pact' and asserting that the Adversary's various names are 'my name,' embodying the spirit of Satan, Opposer, Fornicator, and Deceiver.

relevant_quotes.text: The initiation of the witch into the Circle of Cain, the living Son of Satan and Lilith, the great Harlot and Demoness, the Adversarial deific force of dark instinctual desire and willed continual existence.

With the pen inked in the blood of Abel do I scribe Of when the blade fell I knew pain and a blinding heat Of falling deep into my own created hell, of knowing a heaven Of isolation and self-reliance...

I invoke thee, Cain of the serpent skin, who is the first of witch blood I conjure thee, Cain who is the earthly devil, who is the master of spirits Encircle and awaken within my flesh, my blood, my mind.

I am myself the redeemer and bringer of the Infernal Pact Which holds no bounds nor mortal strain, Yet my desires shall be filled by the Eye within the blackened triangle Of Cain and the Children of Rebellion, rise up with me
Hearken and remain, Satan be thy name... Adversary - Opposer – Fornicator –Deceiver All of which is my name

critical_analysis.relevance: This invocation is highly relevant within contemporary Left Hand Path (LHP) and Draconian traditions, specifically those focusing on Cainite gnosis and Luciferian currents. It explicitly integrates Cain into a mythological framework as the primordial witch, son of Satan and Lilith, thereby providing a foundational lineage for antinomian witchcraft and self-deification practices. The text's emphasis on self-reliance, personal gnosis, and internalizing adversarial forces aligns with modern LHP philosophies that prioritize individual will and spiritual evolution over external subservience. It bridges traditional grimoire-style invocation with modern occult psychology, framing archetypal entities as both external forces and internal potentials for transformation.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience includes practitioners of the Left Hand Path, Luciferians, Draconian initiates, adherents of antinomian magic, and those engaged in Cainite gnosis. It is specifically tailored for individuals seeking self-initiation, empowerment through adversarial archetypes, and a deep, transformative connection to the primordial forces of rebellion and will as embodied by Cain, Satan, and Lilith. It appeals to magicians who view magic as a tool for personal apotheosis and sovereignty.
